title: Can we connect a monitor to laptop and how? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes you can. Most laptops come with an HDMI port. You connect one end of the HDMI cable to your laptop and other end to your TV. It looks like this :  You’ll need an HDMI cable for that. It looks like this :  HDMI port on a TV looks like this :  If your laptop is old, it might come with a VGA/DVI port. In that case make sure that your monitor has a VGA/DVI port. You’ll need a VGA/DVI cable as well. A VGA port looks like this :  A VGA Cable looks like this :  A VGA port (Blue one) on TV looks like this :  A DVI port looks like this :  A DVI Cable looks like this :  A DVI port on TV looks like this  Once connected you’d have to press one of the Function keys on your laptop to switch to the TV or it might happen automatically based on the laptop you’re using.

Generally speaking, all actual laptops (cf. tablets) have a dual head display adapter, with an external video port of some kind, since using laptops to give presentations is a core business activity. So you just plug in the external monitor, and do whatever keyboard-fu is required to activate the display settings (on older laptops, often F5 or Alt-F5). You also need to use the monitor controls to select the correct input. Sometimes it all works seamlessly and automatically, on other occasions you need to tinker with settings. In a few cases, it may never work as the laptop and monitor have no video settings in common. On newer laptops, you may be able to use WiDi/Miracast and connect wirelessly to smart TVs/monitors. In some cases, you may need an adapter. DVI-I to VGA or DVI-D to HDMI adapters are simple and inexpensive. VGA to HDMI adapters are active and need external power, e.g. from a USB port.
